data.title: AFL News & Fantasy Notes 9/8
data.text:
Keep your fantasy game sharp this season.

Enjoy alerts for injuries and team changes for each game this year.

This is your safety net for final team confirmation (60 minutes) prior to every game which also includes the starting sub for each team.

It will specifically cover game/s scheduled for the day. If any news is applicable for listed games it will be updated for you right here.

Make sure you have notifications switched on for those using a desktop aflratings.com.au

You should also turn notifications on for instant player news on X/Twitter AFLRATINGS Player News.

IMPORTANT: A new article link will be pinned to the top of AFLRATINGS Player News on X/Twitter for each day there are games scheduled. It can also be found quite easily on aflratings.com.au.

Follow now on Threads @aflratings.com.au

AFL Round 22 Team Changes

SYDNEY

Late Changes: –

Sub: Cleary

(Sub last game: Luke Parker)

Key players missing: Aaron Francis, Corey Warner, Sam Wicks, Lewis Melican, Tom Papley, Justin McInerney.

Injury List: Sydney

AFLRATINGS Fantasy Notes: Multiple changes for the Swans this week with key players returning to the team, Joel Amartey is expected to play after being managed last week while Dane Rampe provides stability in defence. Luke Parker may start in the 22 this week after being named as the sub the last couple of weeks. Parker and Callum Mills have both been used at centre bounces in recent games. The Swans have a -14.8 average contested possession differential over their last 4 games (Last 2 Ave: -27.0), they have conceded an average of 97.2 uncontested marks from their last 6 games (Season Ave AGA: 85.0).

AFL Weather

COLLINGWOOD

Late Changes: –

Sub: Richards

(Sub last game: Patrick Lipinski)

Key players missing: Jordan De Goey, Nathan Kreuger, Lachlan Sullivan, Brody Mihocek, Tom Mitchell.

Injury List: Collingwood

AFLRATINGS Fantasy Notes: The Magpies will be without Jordan DeGoey for the remainder of the season due to a hamstring injury, Joe Richards returns to the team this week. Patrick Lipinski was the starting sub last week and may start in the 22 this week. Jack Crisp is likely to see solid centre bounce usage along with Scott Pendlebury and Nick Daicos, Ned Long has been used at 54.7% of team centre bounces in the last 2 weeks. The Magpies are averaging 69.8 uncontested marks this season (Rank 18), they have a -12.1 average inside 50 differential from their last 7 games (Season: -3.7).

This article will be updated until the start of each game.

Updates provided by @aflratingsPete
